titleInfo.title: Burlesque baseball team on the Lytle family's front porch.

mods.note:
'Communities entertained themselves with stage plays, parades, benevolent societies, and clubs. Andrew Lytle stands at the back of a group of men dressed for a burlesque baseball game, about 1895. The group poses on the front porch of the Lytle home, 720 North Boulevard.' Mark E. Martin, in Andrew D. Lytleâ€™s Baton Rouge: photographs 1863-1910, (Baton Rouge, LSU Press, 2008), p. 58. Duplicate in LDL http://cdm16313.contentdm.oclc.org/cdm/singleitem/collection/p15140coll12/id/107/rec/2
ZST 04/03/13

titleInfo.title: Andrew D. Lytle's Baton Rouge' Photograph Collection/

extension.hardwareSoftware: Photograph : Original digitized in color using a Microtek Scanmaker 1000XL and converted from tiff to jpeg grayscale using Adobe Photoshop.
